medical_history.chief_complaint: Functional neurologic disorders including dystonia, dysphonia, and abrupt loss of muscular tonus.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had an acute metabolic episode at age 3 resulting in right-sided hemiplegia, followed by a second episode at age 9 with left-sided hemiparesis. At around age 50, she developed functional neurologic disorders with symptoms that improved during follow-up. She continues to experience rare episodes of muscular weakness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Right-sided hemiplegia at 3 years old and left-sided hemiparesis at 9 years old due to acute metabolic episodes managed with a low-protein regimen. History of behavior disorders, suicidal behavior at age 25, and previous treatment for suspected bipolar disorder. Has obsessive-compulsive disorders, alexithymia, and dissociative symptoms.
medical_history.social_history: The patient has experienced traumatic events including sexual abuse and emotional/physical abuse, as well as possible emotional neglect during childhood. She has a history of creating detailed symptom tracking tables affecting her daily life.
